Category: Depot. Instructions: City of Toronto residents can drop off up to 10 passenger and light truck tires per day free of charge at some Drop-Off Depots. Only passenger and light truck tires will be accepted. All other tire types (e.g., heavy truck, forklift and large off-road tires) will not be accepted. Check the Resource Productivity & Recovery Authority website (rpra.ca/programs/tires/collectionsites/) for other tire collection sites.

prompt: used cooking oil/olive oil/vegetable oil (large amount)
completion: Category: HHW. Instructions: Never pour down the sink, drain or toilet because it can cause sewer backups in your home and neighbourhood. Bring this item to a City Drop-Off Depot or Community Environment Day in any container that has a lid, is securely closed and can be left behind. For HHW from 10-50 L/kg, you can request a free Toxic Taxi pickup online or by calling 311. In an apartment/condo, building staff need to request pickup.

Category: Not Accepted. Instructions: If you find a dead animal, contact 311. If on private property, bag skunks/raccoons/unowned domestic animals for pickup (coyotes/deer don't need to be). You can also make an appointment to bring dead animals to a Toronto Animal Shelter for disposal. If the dead animal is under a deck or porch, please call a private company for animal removal.

Category: Garbage Bin. Instructions: Election candidates are responsible for removing signs within 72 hours following the day of an election. Please contact the candidate if your sign is not removed. The City offers election sign recycling services at designated Drop-Off Depots for a month following an election. At any other time, place signs made of any material (including corrugated plastic, plastic sleeves and paperboard) and wooden stakes in the garbage. Metal supports can be brought to select Drop-Off Depots as scrap metal.

Category: Not Accepted. Instructions: Leave grass clippings on your lawn; yard waste containing grass clippings or sod will not be collected. Do not place this item in the Garbage Bin, Green Bin or Blue Bin, and do not bring this item to the City's Drop-Off Depots.

Apartment/condo residents should take item to their building’s designated area for oversized items.

Category: HHW. Instructions: Batteries are Household Hazardous Waste (HHW) and MUST NOT be placed in the Garbage Bin, Blue Bin or Green Bin. Instructions: Place this item in a kraft paper yard waste bag or rigid open-top container (with an external height between 55 cm and 95 cm, with the exception of blue and grey boxes previously used for recycling).
